pronunciation: CONSECRATE, [Latin , to consecrate sacred. See Sacred.]

definitions.text:
Consecrate
 [Latin , to consecrate sacred. See Sacred.]
1. To make or declare to be sacred, by certain ceremonies or rites; to appropriate to sacred uses; to set apart, dedicate, or devote, to the service and worship of God; as, to consecrate church.Thou shalt consecrate Aaron and his sons. Exodus 29:9.All the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are consecrated to the Lord. Joshua 6:19.
2. To canonize; to exalt to the rank of saint; to enroll among the gods, as Roman emperor.
3. To set apart and bless the elements in the eucharist.
4. To render venerable; to make respected; as, rules or principles consecrated by time.CONSECRATE,
Sacred; consecrated; devoted; dedicated.They were assembled in that consecrate place.[This word is now seldom used, unless in poetry.]
